results.title: Christmas lace
results.creator_credit: George Mendeluk, Linda Sorensen and Ko-Zac Productions
results.brief_description: Animated at the beginning, this film is a Christmas story of a girl and her grandmother, both lacemakers, living in rural Quebec in the 1880s. A Christmas bowl left for the Baby Jesus one Christmas Eve is taken by a thief who eventually repays his debt. The film embodies some elements of French-Canadian culture. Special appearance by Monique Mercure and Marcel Sabourin. Cast includes Michael Cote, Guylaine Croteau, Germaine Lemyre and Roger Garand. Story by Linda Sorensen. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Christmas Island
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and Christmas Island Phosphate Commission
results.brief_description: Christmas Island, in the Indian Ocean, provides a large part of the phosphate rock requirements used in Australia and New Zealand. The mining of this phosphate is the only industry on the island. This film covers all aspects of the mining operations, and also shows the social and domestic life of the people engaged in the industry.

results.title: Christmas in Germany: a story of giving
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatisation of a little girl’s perceptions of Christmas in a German town, highlighting the charming traditional Christmas customs and delicate decorations and crafts of Germany. This film is suitable for lower secondary school levels. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Christmas every day
results.brief_description: Based on a story by William Dean Howells, this animated version is about a little girl called Matilda who wishes that every day be Christmas. When her wish is granted by the Christmas fairy, it doesn’t take her, her family, or the whole town long to realise that Christmas is better coming once a year only.

results.title: Christmas Eve on Sesame Street
results.brief_description: Everyone is preparing for Christmas on Sesame Street when Oscar the Grouch asks his friend Big Bird to explain how Santa Claus “who is built like a dump truck” gets down all those skinny little chimneys. Big Bird, with the help of all his Sesame Street friends, tries to solve the Santa Claus riddle and finds that the true miracle of Christmas is in the loving and sharing between friends. Features Jim Henson’s Sesame Street Muppets and the Sesame Street live cast.

results.title: Christmas Crackers
results.brief_description: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War.

constellations_other.name: Australia and WW2
constellations_other.description: A constellation exploring representations of Australians during World War 2.

results.description: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War. Through the course of the film, Mrs Sprod welcomes home her son George from the Army, John from the Airforce, Dan from the Navy and her brother-in-law Des Carter from the Army. The film includes captions and illustrations drawn by George Sprod as well as acting performances from nine members of the immediate family.
description_for_label: This amateur film made by John Sprod re-enacts a reunion between the family members when the four men return to Adelaide from active service overseas during the Second World War. Through the course of the film, Mrs Sprod welcomes home her son George from the Army, John from the Airforce, Dan from the Navy and her brother-in-law Des Carter from the Army. The film includes captions and illustrations drawn by George Sprod as well as acting performances from nine members of the immediate family.

results.title: Christmas cracker
results.creator_credit: Gerald Potterton, Grant Munro, Norman McLaren, Jeffrey Hale, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A seasonal pleasantry consisting of three animation segments, employing tricks in movie magic by NFB artists and animators, and with specially arranged music. Three scenarios are presented: a rendition of Jingle Bells in which paper cut-out figures dance; a dime-store rodeo of tin toys; and a story of decorating the perfect Christmas tree. Film without words. (Seven awards, including Rome; Naarden; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)

results.title: Christmas classics. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: A compilation of 6 classic Christmas tales including. “Christmas comes but once a year” (dir. Dave Fleischer): When children in an orphanage wake on Christmas day to find they are left with a miserable collection of presents it’s up to the inventive Professor Grampy to restore their faith in Christmas. “Hector’s hectic life” (dir. Bill Tytla): Hector is trying so hard to be a good little puppy before Santa arrives but when he has to look after three mischievous puppies it’s going to be harder than he thought. “Snow foolin’” (dir. I Sparber): The forest animals make the most of the first winter snow as they ski, skate, build snowmen and have snowball fights. “Jack Frost”: A young grizzly bear decides he won’t hibernate for winter but the task proves harder than he thought and Jack Frost has to save him from an uncertain fate. “Little drummer boy” (prod., dirs. Arthur Rankin Jnr., Jules Bass): Greer Garson narrates this classic tale, presented in wonderful puppetry. The Little Drummer Boy, blessed with a special gift follows the Three Kings to Bethlehem. Features the voices of the Vienna Boys Choir. “Christmas through the ages” (dir. Milan Herzog): An entertaining history of the legends and customs of Christmas throughout the world.

results.title: Christmas classics. -Volume 1
results.brief_description: This tape features 5 classic Christmas tales: THE LITTLEST ANGEL; a little angel who can’t stay out of trouble consults the gates of heaven for advice. His wish is granted and the angel becomes the inspiration of Jesus, based on the story by Charles Tazewell; SILENT NIGHT; a special story about how this famous carol came to be written in Oberndorf, Germany in the late nineteenth century, produced by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera; RUDOLPH THE RED-NOSED REINDEER; Rudolph’s shiny nose helps save the day one fateful Christmas, directed by Max Fleischer; SOMEWHERE IN DREAMLAND; two poor children dream of the riches of Christmas to escape the sombre Christmas morning poverty has given them. A surprise awaits them courtesy of some kind shop keepers, directed by Dave Fleischer; SANTA’S SURPRISE; an international group of children set out to find what Santa does after he’s delivered all the presents, directed by Seymour Kneitel. No other production details available.

results.title: Christmas cartoon
results.brief_description: A “real life” family celebrating Christmas, show their children a film “Toyland”, a Paul Terry Toon cartoon presented by Castle films, showing all the children’s favourite characters and Father Christmas distributing Christmas presents. Ends up with the “real life” family singing and wishing you, the audience, a Merry Christmas to all.
